paper_abstract: The Matrix Packing Down problem asks to find a row permutation of a given ( 0, 1)-matrix in such a way that the total sum of the first non-zero column indexes is maximized. We study the computational complexity of this problem. We prove that the Matrix Packing Down problem is NP-complete even when restricted to zero trace symmetric ( 0, 1)-matrices or to ( 0, 1)-matrices with at most two 1' s per column. Also, as intermediate results, we introduce several new simple graph layout problems which are proved to be NP-complete.
